metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15378 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in ClamAV versions prior to 0.100.2 could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition. The vulnerability is due to an error related to the MEW unpacker within the "unmew11()" function (libclamav/mew.c), which can be exploited to trigger an invalid read memory access via a specially crafted EXE file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
